grammarModel.genericTools

Interface ISyntacticChains

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IChains
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SyntacticChains

    public interface ISyntacticChains
extends IChains
    A ISyntacticChains is a list (endowed with navigation functionalities) of all the paths of a syntactic structure from its generated node to one of its terminals.
    Author:
    Gael Tregouet
    See Also:
    ISyntacticStructure

        equals, getChains, getRoot, hasNext, next, resetIndexes

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentLeafID

        long getCurrentLeafID()
        Returns:
        the ID of the current chain terminal (or 'leaf').

      • getPathToLeafIDs

        java.util.Map<java.util.List<java.lang.String>,java.util.Set<java.lang.Long>> getPathToLeafIDs()
                                                                                        throws GrammarModelException
        Returns:
        a mapping of all the paths minus their terminal elements, with the IDs of all the terminals that can be attained by following such a path.
        Throws:
        GrammarModelException

      • getLeaf

        java.lang.String getLeaf(java.lang.Long leafID)
                  throws GrammarModelException
        Parameters:
        leafID - the ID of the target terminal (or 'leaf').
        Returns:
        the name of the target terminal.
        Throws:
        GrammarModelException

      • hasProperty

        boolean hasProperty(java.lang.String property)
             throws GrammarModelException
        Parameters:
        property - the name of the property that is looked for.
        Returns:
        true if any of the chains (or 'paths') owns this property.
        Throws:
        GrammarModelException
